Module com.cyte.edamame
Package com.cyte.edamame

Class EDAmameController

java.lang.Object
com.cyte.edamame.EDAmameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class EDAmameController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Main Controller for the EDAmame Application.

Implements all general functionality that is not delegated to an editor or other sub-module. Actions such as creating, opening, closing librarys, projects and files is handled by this controller.

Author:
Jeff Wiegley, Ph.D., jeffrey.wiegley@gmail.com

  • Field Details

    • LOGGER

      private static final Logger LOGGER
      The logger for the entire application. All classes/modules should obtain and use this static logger.

    • stage

      private final javafx.stage.Stage stage
      The stage hosting this controller.

    • editors

      private final javafx.collections.ObservableMap<javafx.scene.control.Tab,Editor> editors
      All editors instantiated are remembered in a HashMap for fast lookup keyed by their main tab.

    • logTab

      private javafx.scene.control.Tab logTab
      The tab used to hold the TextArea used for application logging.

    • logArea

      private javafx.scene.control.TextArea logArea
      The TextArea to display logged information on

    • splitPane

      private javafx.scene.control.SplitPane splitPane
      The main split pane separating always available global controls on the left from editor tabs on right.

    • controlsStackPane

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane controlsStackPane
      The stack pane on left of split used to contain different control setups.

    • controlTabPane

      private javafx.scene.control.TabPane controlTabPane
      the TabPane used to hold all the main controls. Displayed in the "navigation" pane of the controls stack.

    • mainTabPane

      private javafx.scene.control.TabPane mainTabPane
      primary TabPane displayed on the right of split used by EDAmame to present editors and information.

    • editorToolBarStack

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane editorToolBarStack
      A stack of toolbars to the right of the main EDAmame toolbar. Editors can provide own toolbars for here.

    • menuBar

      private javafx.scene.control.MenuBar menuBar
      The main EDAmame menu bar

    • viewLogItem

      private javafx.scene.control.MenuItem viewLogItem
      the menu item for toggling log visibility.

  • Constructor Details

    • EDAmameController

      public EDAmameController(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Constructs an instance of this controller with knowledge of the stage that it is attached to. Knowledge of the stage allows the controller to entirely take control of proper closing activities even when its an onCloseRequest generated by a user killing the application of an operating system's "close" window decoration.
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage that is hosting/using this controller.

  • Method Details

    • executeOnShown

      private void executeOnShown()
      Execute activites required to be done once the main Application stage is finally shown. (Activities performed in the initialize(URL, ResourceBundle) happen before the various scene nodes have been sized, laid out, and rendered. This provides a location to perform all startup tasks required but unsuitable for standard initialization.

    • restoreDividerPosition

      private void restoreDividerPosition()
      Restores the main split pane's divider position between runs of the application.

      The application establishes a main look and feel that consists of a split pane containing two nodes. The left node is used to contain to level controls specific to the entire EDAmame application. The right pane is a tab pane that provides tabbed locations for editors and other sub-modules to place their controls. The user's selection of divider position is maintained between runs of the application.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      JavaFX stage initialization procedures
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      rb - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • changeLoggingToTab

      private void changeLoggingToTab()
      Change the log handler for the package wide logger from stdout to a TextArea node. EDAmame has a dedicated tab for displaying log information. changeLoggingToTab removes all log handlers from the logger and replaces them with a handler that appends requested logging information to a TextArea in the dedicated log tab.

    • performExit

      private void performExit()
      performExit() implements graceful and intelligent shutdown of the EDAmame application. All open editors will be requested to perform their close/save/shutdown activities and the EDAmame application will exit gracefully. This action is triggered by menu items or On Close Request.

    • saveWindowContext

      private void saveWindowContext()
      Saves the window position and size of the application as Java Preferences. The values of the size and position of the application are saved to the Java Preference storage. User preferences and settings for application behavior are stored in YAML files to avoid overly complicating platform dependent stores such as registries.

    • restoreWindowContext

      private void restoreWindowContext()
      Restores the window position and size of the application. The values of the size and position of the application when this context was last saved is restored. Context is typically saved when the application exits gracefully.

    • enableEditorTabSelectionLogic

      private void enableEditorTabSelectionLogic()
      Enables to controller logic for switching between editor tabs. Editors are composed of several nodes. A single main editor tab that is always visible in editorTabPane. A set of control tabs that are only present/visible in the controlTabPane when the editor is selected. A toolBar that is only visible in the toolBar area when the editor is selected. A set of menus and items that are only present in the menus when the editor is selected. enableEditorTabSelectionLogic provides the control for the presence and visibility of these items based on tab selection. When a tab is selected the UI components for the previously selected editor are removed/hidden and the components for the newly selected editor are enabled/shown.

    • activateEditor

      private void activateEditor(Editor editor)
      Symbol Libraries, Footprint Libraries, Schematics, PCBs are all handled by their own editors. Editors supply their own controllers and controls. The EDAmameController folds these controls into its own menus, toolbars and windows by obtaining, reparenting and controlling the visibility of those controls. Editors are activated by EDAmame by making sure that only the selected tab's controls are visible and accessible.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to make controls visible for.

    • deactivateEditor

      private void deactivateEditor(Editor editor)
      Editors are deactivated by EDAmame by making sure that unselected editor tabs' controls are invisible and inaccessible.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to make controls invisible for.

    • addEditor

      private void addEditor(Editor editor)
      Editors are added by EDAmame by including their menu items and toolbars in its menus and toolbar areas.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to setup and add controls for. They all start out invisible/unavailable.

    • removeEditor

      private void removeEditor(Editor editor)
      Editors are removed by EDAmame by removing their menu items and toolbars in its menus and toolbar areas. This should really only be done once an editor has been closed and has no need to save data.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to remove controls for.

    • clearLogAction

      protected void clearLogAction()
      A simple event handle to clear the TextArea/Pane where logging happens.

    • toggleLogTabVisibility

      private void toggleLogTabVisibility()
      The log tab can be made visible or not. It is always the right most tab of all tabs. When explicitly added the log tab is automatically selected.

    • correctViewLogItemText

      private void correctViewLogItemText()
      Simple function to correct the textual information present on the menu item for toggling the state of the log window.

    • selectNavigationTabPane

      private void selectNavigationTabPane()
      Select the "navigation" pane is the main controls to show. The left element of the main split pane is a global controls area and is designed to support future features. It is a stacked pane containing as many controls as needed by EDAmame development. The primary control is a tab pane. Editors add their controls into this tab pane as additional tabs. This primary tab pane control is called the "Navigation" Pane.

    • onTestButtonClick

      protected void onTestButtonClick()
      A test method for a test button to add a fake editor to the page to verify concept.

    • onTestButtonClickDatabase

      protected void onTestButtonClickDatabase()
      A test method for checking database connectivity.
